meanings.definition: To load or burden with a heavy or excessive amount
meanings.sent1: The workers were ladening the truck with boxes of fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She ladened her backpack with books for school.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ladening its cheeks with nuts looked quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds ladening the sky signaled an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The branches of the tree were ladening with ripe apples, ready for picking.

meanings.definition: The action of loading or burdening with a heavy or excessive amount
meanings.sent1: The ladening of the ship with cargo took hours to complete.
meanings.sent2: The ladening of responsibilities on his shoulders made him feel overwhelmed.
meanings.sent3: The ladening of toppings on the pizza made it difficult to pick up a slice.
meanings.sent4: The ladening of gifts under the Christmas tree brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent5: The ladening of the shelves with books made the library look full and inviting.
